Description: Full NIH project number used as a unique identifier linking to publications and patents.
7-digit unique identifier of award record in NSF database.
Title of the funded grant, contract, or intramural project.
Title of the funded grant or project.
Statement articulating a project’s potential to improve public health.
Statement detailing the project’s background, scientific relevance, and impact.
Acronym for the NIH Institute or Center(s) providing funding.
Values: e.g., NCI, NIAID, NHLBI, NIMH, NIGMS, etc.

Description: Acronym for the NSF directorate or office providing funding.
3-character code identifying the grant or contract activity.
1-character code identifying the category of the grant or project.
Values: e.g., R = research project, K = career development, U = cooperative agreement

Description: Name of the institution, research organization, business, or agency receiving funding.
City of the business office of the grantee organization or contractor.
2-character abbreviation for the state of the grantee organization or contractor.
Start date of a project; for multi-project grants, the start date of the parent award.
End date of a project; for multi-project grants, the end date of the parent award.
Fiscal year from which project funds were obligated (2021–2026).
Date of NIH award notice or Notice of Grant Award.
Date of last application amendment (used as surrogate for award notice date).
Total project funding from all NIH Institutes and Centers for a given fiscal year.
Total funding awarded to date for the NSF project.
Fiscal year in which the project's award funds were officially notified to the recipient organization(2020–2025).
Fiscal year in which the project's award funds were officially notified to the recipient organization(2020–2025).
